results.title: Howard Hodgkin [Widescreen]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “TheEYE”.
Part of a series of interview-based profiles of contemporary visual artists in Britain - this episode focuses on Howard Hodgkin. Hodgkin, one of the world’s leading painters whose art is admired by both critics and the public, labours over his work for lengthy periods, characteristically producing richly coloured, and sumptuous compositions that spill over into the frame. His work straddles abstraction and representation whilst displaying an awareness of history and the potential for art. Larger scale work such as “Americana” and “After Vuillard”, demonstrate his concern to engage the viewer in new and challenging ways. In an illuminating interview Hodgkin speaks earnestly, and humbly, about the process of creating new work, his methodology, influences and ambition, addresses the subjects of the functionality of colour, composition, and the importance of visual art to him.

results.title: Howard Hawks: American artist
results.creator_credit: Paula Jalfon, BFI, BBC, Bravo and Kevin MacDonald
results.brief_description: Howard Hawks has been hailed as the quintessential auteur due to his mastery of a wide range of genres from screwball comedies, film noir and thrillers to musicals and gangster films. Combining previously unseen home movies, out-takes and other archival footage with interviews with actors and directors including Lauren Bacall, James Caan, Angie Dickinson, Peter Bogdanovich, William Friedkin and Michael Mann, this documentary provides an insight into Hawks’ personality and professional achievements. Narrated by Stephen Frears.

results.title: Howard's End
results.creator_credit: Ismail Merchant, Merchant Ivory Productions and James Ivory
results.brief_description: From director James Ivory comes the magical and compelling film version of E.M. Forster’s classic novel; beautifully produced and brilliantly acted. The stoical and unyielding Mr. Wilcox (Anthony Hopkins) is part of the rich, ruling class which traditionally stomps on those who are weaker, his repression causes him to lash out at those who are not. The working class Mr. Leonard Baste is a dreamer, imaginative and intelligent, but he is trapped by his class and the ignorance of others. Two sisters, Margaret and Helen Schlegel (Emma Thompson and Helena Bonham-Carter) form a precarious bridge between these two men’s worlds and the result is a compelling and fascinating story about love and betrayal, privilege and poverty, a masterpiece of entertainment. Also stars Vanessa Redgrave, James Wilby and Samuel West.

results.title: Howard
results.creator_credit: Julian Biggs, ONF | NFB and Don Haldane
results.brief_description: The problems of the teenager caught in the crossfire of adult opinion and youthful enthusiasms. Howard, just out of school, was intending to be a chemist, but wanted first to make a footloose tour of Canada with a school pal during his summer vacation. His wish is strongly resisted by his socially conforming parents. Howard’s resultant confusion, to which the film gives shape, illustrates some of the inner conflicts that arise in teenagers when every fresh impulse is rationalised out of existence.

results.title: How you see; How the telephone talks
results.creator_credit: Boldwyn Bray Pictograph, F. Lyle Goldman and E. Dean Parmelee
results.brief_description: Rudementary illustrations of the workings of the camera and how the eye receives the image. The workings of the telephone and how the machine translates sound waves and conveys to the receiver. Of historic interest.

results.title: How would you like it if?
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Cockram, Slater Sound Studio, South Australian Film Corporation and Brian Hannant
results.brief_description: A film about moral issues based on the philosophy ‘Think about the deed before you do it - consider other people’. Dramatised excerpts of unsocial behaviour are presented followed by questions asked about the incident portrayed. The content includes examples of wrecking an older brother’s paintings, swearing, shoplifting, school fights and ethnic discrimination.

results.title: How wonderful
results.brief_description: This is a quirky film about Kerry, a modern career woman, who becomes pregnant for the first time. With hormones whizzing around her body and her mind whirling with fantasies, we view the side of pregnancy never seen before - from the expectant mother’s eyes. As she tries to deal with mental, emotional and physical changes, she begins to fantasise about her own capability as a mother, her misogynist obstetrician, over-zealous relatives and a husband in the midst of sympathy toothaches and training for his first marathon race! Cast includes Tracy Mann and Jim Holt.

results.title: How wings are attached to the backs of angels = comment les ailes sont attachees au dos des anges
results.creator_credit: Marcy Page, ONF | NFB and Craig Welch
results.brief_description: A man’s obsession with control manifests itself in the manipulation of his gadgets and his practice of a science which dissects and reduces. Despite his meticulous nature he is not beyond longing, but has his crimes and fears pushed him beyond redemption? This film provides the viewer with a surreal eleven minute experience.
